name: ING
mission: OUR MISSION IS TO PROMOTE PEACE AMONG ALL, BY FOSTERING A DEEPER MORE NUANCED UNDERSTANDING OF MUSLIMS AND OTHER FAITH-BASED, RACIAL/ETHNIC, AND CULTURA...
theoryOfChange: ING has a published 'Global Green Funding Framework' (updated in 2024) which outlines its strategy for financing and refinancing sustainable assets and projects that contribute to the UN Sustainable Development Goals and ING's sustainability strategy. This framework provides a robust structure to steer investments towards assets that assist in reaching targets set by the Paris Climate Agreement and EU Environmental Objectives. ING publishes annual 'Global Green Funding Allocation and Impact Reports' to provide transparency on the assets and financing under this framework, detailing impact metrics such as avoided carbon emissions and estimated annual energy generation. The framework aligns with the International Capital Market Association's (ICMA) Green Bond Principles and has been externally assessed.

The organization operates the Islamic Speakers Bureau and provides specialized Inclusion and Belonging Training to educators and community leaders [2][5].

Value interfaith dialogue as a tool for social cohesion

ideal_donor_profile.not_ideal_for: Donors seeking high program-to-overhead ratios or those looking to fulfill zakat obligations.

impact_evidence.evidence_grade_explanation: Grade C reflects consistent internal tracking of <cite id="11">educator satisfaction</cite> and <cite id="13">effectiveness ratings</cite>, but a lack of independent, third-party impact evaluations.
impact_evidence.theory_of_change_summary: ING creates impact by training speakers and educators to provide accurate information about Islam, thereby reducing prejudice and fostering inclusion in public institutions.
impact_evidence.why_evidence_matters: Evidence in educational outreach ensures that the curriculum actually changes perceptions and improves the environment for Muslim students and professionals.

long_term_outlook.room_for_funding_explanation: With a <cite id="23">revenue of $622,869</cite> and a national mission, the organization has significant capacity to scale its educational programs if funding increases.

strengths.detail: ING's curriculum and interfaith panels are utilized in <cite id="3">all 50 states</cite>, achieving a <cite id="11">96% educator satisfaction rate</cite> regarding content relevance.
The organization operates with exceptional efficiency in resource acquisition, spending <cite id="9">$0.00 to raise every $1</cite> in charitable contributions.
Operating since <cite id="1">1993</cite>, the organization has established a <cite id="12">33-year track record</cite> in the religious-cultural education space.

strengths_deep_dive: Islamic Networks Group distinguishes itself through its specialized training modules, such as 'Healthcare for the Muslim Patient' and its <cite id="2">Inclusion and Belonging Training</cite>. These programs are backed by strong user feedback, including an <cite id="13">educator effectiveness rating of 89%</cite>. Furthermore, the organization has successfully diversified its impact by hosting an average of <cite id="14">25 monthly events</cite> and maintaining at least <cite id="15">one interfaith panel per week</cite>, ensuring consistent community engagement.
rich_narrative.summary: Islamic Networks Inc, commonly known as Islamic Networks Group (ING), is a long-standing educational non-profit founded in <cite id="1">1993</cite> that works to counter prejudice through interfaith dialogue and cultural literacy. The organization operates at a national scale, providing <cite id="2">educational resources and interfaith panels</cite> that reach audiences across all <cite id="3">50 U.S. states</cite>. ING's primary delivery model focuses on capacity building, specifically through its Islamic Speakers Bureau and specialized <cite id="4">Inclusion and Belonging Training</cite> for educators and healthcare professionals. In 2023, the organization reported <cite id="5">total revenue of $622,869</cite>, primarily driven by <cite id="6">$563,428 in public contributions</cite>. While the organization maintains a significant reach, with a <cite id="7">projected annual reach of 2,000,000</cite> individuals through its digital and in-person programming, its financial structure is characterized by a <cite id="8">program expense ratio of 39.5%</cite>. This indicates that a substantial portion of its annual budget is currently allocated toward administrative and fundraising functions rather than direct program delivery. Despite these internal allocation challenges, ING demonstrates high fundraising efficiency, reporting a <cite id="9">cost of $0.00 per $1 raised</cite>, and maintains a healthy liquidity position with <cite id="10">5.2 months of working capital</cite> in reserve.
